alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 9:16PM EDT until April 06 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near East Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including East Juliette...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Falling Creek near East Juliette. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest around 13.5 feet then fall below flood stage after midnight and continue falling late tonight. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
